bibl.title: Surgeon General's Office Report Card, October 10, 1905

div1.p: These excerpts regard the erection of a tablet to Walter Reed at Kings County Hospital, Brooklyn, New York. There is also a request to see if a memorial will be built to Reed in Chicago, Illinois. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Surgeon General's Office Report Card, October 10, 1905
div1.p:
W
Oct. 10: 1905
The Monumental News,
#324 Dearborn St., Chicago,
Ill, Oct. 5: 1905, desires to be
informed whether any steps
have been taken toward erecting
a memorial to the late Dr. Reed.
Sec'y. of State, Oct. 3; 1905, refers.
Sec'y of War, no date refers.
N.

Respectfully returned to Mr. R.J.
Haight, Publisher, The Monumental News,
324 Dearborn St., Chicago, Illinois, with
the information that an association
has been formed to raise a fund of
$25,000 for the purpose of erecting
a memorial to the late Major Walter
Reed, Surgeon, U.S. Army, who demonstrated
sketch of Dr.Reed is sent you under
separate enclosure, from which it will
be seen that Dr. Reed, although a great
public benefactor, did not give up his
life demonstrating the mosquito theo-
ry of yellow fever.

By order of the Surgeon General:
J.R.K., Major, Surgeon, U.S. Army. A.

X NOV 25 1905
William C Woolsey. Prest -
Kings Co. Alumni Asso.
Brooklyn N.Y. Nov. 24.05.
For information relative
to service etc in case of
the late Major Walter B.
Reed, Surg. for use in the
erection of a tablet to his
memory in the Kings Co.
Hospital [unclear] enclos. G.
✗

Nov. 29, 1905, Dr. William C. Woolsey,
Pres. Kings Co. Alumni Assocn. Kings
County Hospital, 88 Lafayette Ave.,
Brooklyn, N.Y. Sir: I am directed by
the Surgeon General to acknowledge
the receipt of your note of the 24th
instant and to express his pleasure
at the proposition to erect a tablet
to the memory of Walter Reed in the
Write nothing below this line.
3-958 Write nothing above this line.
Kings County Hospital.

He has also instructed me to give
you the information asked for. I send
you under separate enclosure a short
biographical sketch of Dr. Reed, to-
gether with action of various learned
societies at the time of his death
which has been collected and publish-
ed by the Walter Reed Memorial Asso-
ciation. The literature relating to
the work in Cuba of the Commission
of which Dr.Reed was the President,
and of which he was in the language
of General Wood “The originating,
directing and controling mind,” will
also be sent you.

Dr.Reed's assistant, who was also
a member of the Commission, is Dr.
James Carroll, U.S.A., at present on
duty in this city as Curator of the
Army Med. Museum, 7th and B.Sts., S.W.
He is also Professor of Bacteriology
in the Army Med. School. Dr. Carroll
has the honor of having suffered the
first attack of experimental yellow
fever in these epoch-making experi-
ments.

When the tablet is completed,
this office would be pleased to re-
ceive a photograph of it for file in
the Library of the Surgeon General's
Office.
